thread.title: Thames Water fined £20m for polluting river with 1.4bn litres of raw sewage
thread.title_full: Thames Water fined £20m for polluting river with 1.4bn litres of raw sewage

author: Hatty Collier
title: Thames Water fined £20m for polluting river with 1.4bn litres of raw sewage
text:
Wednesday 22 March 2017 11:52 GMT Click to followThe Evening Standard Thames Water has been hit with a record fine for dumping raw sewage in the Thames Environment Agency/PA 
Thames Water has been hit with a record £20.3m fine for polluting the River Thames. 
The firm was today given the largest ever penalty for a water utility company for an environmental disaster. 
The company was responsible for polluting the River Thames with 1.4bn litres of raw sewage. 
The sewage was dumped in the river in 2013 and 2014. Scum in a ditch downstream of the Henley Sewage Treatment Works (Environment Agency/PA) 
This story is being updated More about:
